text: The 2013 Men's EuroHockey Championship III was the 5th edition of the men's EuroHockey Championship III, the third level of the European field hockey championships organized by the European Hockey Federation. It was held from 12 to 18 August 2013 in Lausanne, Switzerland. The tournament also served as a qualifier for the 2015 Men's EuroHockey Championship II, with the finalists qualifying. ==Qualified teams== The following eight teams, shown with pre- tournament world rankings, will competed in the tournament. {| class=wikitable !Event !Dates !Location !Quotas !Qualifier(s) |- |2011 EuroHockey Championship II |8—14 August 2011 |Vinnytsia, Ukraine |align=center|2 | (35) (37) |- |2011 EuroHockey Championship III |23–30 July 2011 |Catania, Italy |align=center|5 | (49) (41) (45) (51) (43) |- |2011 EuroHockey Championship IV |2–7 August 2011 |Athens, Greece |align=center|1 | (53) |- !colspan="3"|Total !8 ! |} ==Results== All times are local (UTC+2). ===Preliminary round=== ====Pool A==== \---- \---- ====Pool B==== \---- \---- ===Fifth to eighth place classification=== ====Pool C==== The points obtained in the preliminary round against the other team are taken over. \---- ===First to fourth place classification=== ====Semi-finals==== \---- ====Third and fourth place==== ====Final==== ==Final standings== {|class=wikitable style="text-align:center;" |- !Rank !!|Team |-bgcolor=bbf3bb |Image:Gold medal icon.svg |align=left| |-bgcolor=bbf3bb |Image:Silver medal icon.svg |align=left| |- |Image:Bronze medal icon.svg |align=left| |- |4 |align=left| |- |5 |align=left| |- |6 |align=left| |- |7 |align=left| |-bgcolor=ffbbbb |8 |align=left| |} Promoted to the EuroHockey Championship II Relegated to the EuroHockey Championship IV ==References== Category:EuroHockey Championship III Category:International field hockey competitions hosted by Switzerland Men 3 EuroHockey Championship III Men EuroHockey Championship III Men Category:Sports competitions in Lausanne Category:21st century in Lausanne
